com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class MergeRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.MergeRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class MergeRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest
    Merges two base object records that have been identified as representing the same object.

    For example, there may be one base object record with the name 'Alex Watson' and another with the name 'Alexander Watson'; each base object record has its own set of cross reference records. These records are determined to represent the same person so the records are merged. The result is a single base object record that has all the cross reference records from the original two base object records. The consolidated value for each field in the record is determined by the trust configuration.

    When merging records in a base object with state management enabled, records in any state can be merged together. However, the following rules apply specifying a PENDING record as the target of a merge.

    • If both records being merged together are PENDING, the records are merged as normal.
    • If a PENDING target record is merged with an ACTIVE or DELETED source record, the target and source records are automatically swapped so the PENDING record becomes the source and the ACTIVE or DELETED record becomes the target.

    For more information on state management, see the Siperian Hub Administrator Guide and Siperian Hub Data Steward Guide.

    The operation merges the source record into the target record. After the merge, the rowid for the combined record is that of the target record.

    An alternate to MergeRequest is MultiMergeRequest which can be used to merge two or more records in a single operation.

    Required Parameters:

    • SiperianObjectUid - package or base object. The primary table of the package must be a base object. This is the object containing the records to be merged.

    • setSourceRecordKey(RecordKey) - Identifies the record that will be merged into the target.

    • setTargetRecordKey(RecordKey) - Identifies to record that will be the survivor of the merge. This means that the ROWID_OBJECT of this record is the ROWID_OBJECT of the merged record. Other fields in the base object are based on the trust configuration.

    Optional Parameters:

    • taskId - If specified and the match table record associated with the merge being performed is contains the specified value, the task will be marked as CLOSED. Otherwise, any task associated with the records being merged will be marked OBSOLETE.

    Usage Example:

    The following example merges a record with ROWID_OBJECT = 782 into a record with ROWID_OBJECT = 123 using the package ADDRESS_UPDATE.

    MergeRequest request = new MergeRequest();
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.ADDRESS_UPDATE");

    request.setSourceRecordKey(RecordKey.rowid("782"));

    request.setTargetecordKey(RecordKey.rowid("123"));
    MergeResponse response = (MergeResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    Additional Information:

    • Siperian Hub Schema Manager: "Merge Settings" Tab on the Match/Merge Setup Details dialog.
    • Siperian Hub Administrator Guide: refer to "Configuring Merge Settings"
    • Siperian Hub Data Steward Guide: refer to "Using Merge Manager"

    See Also:
    MergeResponse, UnmergeRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: MergeResponse

    API Group: Data Update/Insert
